#Text=[0024] FIG. 2 is a block diagram of a node 202 in accordance with the present invention.
#Text=The node 202 comprises a smart antenna 204, a controller 206, a memory 208 and an optional wired link 210.
#Text=The wired link 210 may be a link to the core network 110 or to another node.
#Text=The node 202 implements a signal processing algorithm to adapt to user movement, changes in the radio-frequency environment and multipath along with co-channel interference.
#Text=A radio resource management (RRM) function implemented by the controller 206 decides how radio resources should be allocated in the node 202.
#Text=[0025] The smart antenna 204 comprises a plurality of antenna elements (not shown) to generate a plurality of directional beams under the control of the controller 206.
#Text=Each beam functions as a wireless connection between the node 202 and other nodes.
#Text=As aforementioned, since the node 202 is typically fixed in a particular location, a beam direction and configuration between two nodes can be predetermined and stored in the memory 208.
#Text=The memory 208 maintains a list of other nodes and beam direction and configuration information for each of those other nodes.

#Text=When the node 202 is required to transmit messages, such as backhaul data, to another node, the controller 206 retrieves corresponding beam direction and configuration information from the memory 208 and generates a directional beam steered to a particular direction and transmits the messages using the beam.
#Text=[0026] In the case of a hybrid node 102n, this process is followed in establishing wireless connections to other nodes with the help of the smart antenna 204.

#Text=When the hybrid node 102n establishes a backhaul connection to the core network 110, or another node, there is no configuration information or no beam selection since the wired link 210 is physically fixed and will always provide a connection between the same two nodes.
#Text=[0027] In accordance with the present invention, the smart antenna 204 preferably has a multi-beam capability, in which each beam can be used independently.
#Text=A node 202 generates more than one directional beam to transmit backhaul data to a plurality of other nodes at the same time.
#Text=Since the same frequency may be reused for more than one directional beam in the same coverage area, the system capacity is substantially increased.
#Text=[0028] Several nodes may be coupled together with several beams.
#Text=This makes it convenient to change connections and dynamically adapt to changes in the radio environment.
#Text=For example, two beams may be provided for connection between two nodes.
#Text=If one beam suffers from excessive interference, then the nodes may switch to another beam for transmission of messages.
